channel.title: June on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in June on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: June 2013 index
item.description: An index of this weblog for June. Father's Day Fires: Black Forest (2013), Howes Lake (2011) Flooding: Minot, ND (2011) Juneberries Power outage maps (2011) Sand County Almanac for June Storms: Derecho (2012) Strawberries Walking around, a new urban game (1), bonus points (2)

item.title: May 2013 Peony Bloom Countdown, The Peony Garden, Nichols Arboretum, Ann Arbor
item.description: The peonies bloom every year in the Peony Garden at the Nichols Arboretum in Ann Arbor. This year's prediction for the first bloom date is May 20-25, 2013, and for the peak season at about June 1, 2013; that according to the garden's Peony Bloom Countdown as of May 1. By midsummers night the blooming is over and the garden is all green. More seasonal blooming information at the arb's spring, summer, fall, and winter pages.

item.title: Kids Read Comics 2013, June 22 & 23, 2013 at the Ann Arbor District Library
item.description: Mark your calendars. More details at the Kids Read Comics web site, or on Facebook.

item.title: Walking Around: bonus points
item.description: I walked a lot more today than I normally would have walked, thanks to my new game Walking Around. Here's some of the bonus points I scored that I wouldn't have scored in my previous quest, Sitting Around Typing. Pedestrian Path (+1). It's always good to find a way to get from here to there that's not on any map. The pedestrian path I found connects Needham Road to Amelia Place.

item.title: Strawberry season, 2011 report
item.description: I went strawberry picking with my boys on Father's Day at Rowe's in Rawsonville. We picked two full trays of berries in what seemed like no time flat. The sun was not too hot, and the berries were not too ripe, and I think we nailed the right day to pick pretty much perfectly. The challenge now is what to do with all of those berries. Some have been frozen, others are under sugar and hopefully will end up as sorbet, and still more get stored in the bellies of friends.

item.title: What are you doing on Father's Day in Ann Arbor? Take our poll.
Ann Arbor Mini Maker Faire 2011, Saturday June 4
item.description: Here's the event poster; the web site is www.a2makerfaire.com/2011/ Hope to see you there.

item.title: Shiawassee River Paddle Event--June 7, 2009 - Holly, MI to Fenton, MI
item.description: More info on the event web site. Canoes available for rental thru Heavners Livery Shuttle transport all day long until 6pm Join over 100 local paddlers for a day of fun PUT-IN  WaterWorks Park 602 South Broad St, Holly, MI 48442-1674 TAKE-OUT Strom Park 299 South East Street, Fenton,MI near the East Street Bridge. Shiawassee River Paddle Event--June 7, 2009 Start : WaterWorks Park in Holly, Michigan End : Strom Park in Fenton, Michigan Distance : 7 scenic miles of numerous twists and turns Schedule : 10:00 am : On-site registration WaterWorks Park 11:30 am : Introductory Ceremony 11:45 am : Experienced Canoeists Start 12:15 pm : Novice/Youth Canoeists Start 12:45 pm : Kayak/ Single person canoeists Start ***1:15 pm : Leisure/fun paddle Start ***** 6:00 pm : Final river sweep completed
